p: In Brazil, the prevalence of HCV is around 1% to 2% in the general population, but it ranges from 0.9% to 2.4% in the North region of the country [ 6, 7] and it reaches more than 30% among injecting drug users [ 8]. Seroprevalence to HCV in the Pacui Island, Para, a small village within Cameta municipality, was 8.8% and RNA persistence was detected among 62.5% of the seroreactive subjects [ 9].
